understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method called getIndexSummaryCapacityInMB() which returns a long value representing the index summary capacity in MB.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration setting for the fixed memory pool size in MB for SSTable index summaries. The method getIndexSummaryCapacityInMB() is used to retrieve this configuration value.

config_description: A fixed memory pool size in MB for for SSTable index summaries. If left empty, this will default to 5% of the heap size. If the memory usage of all index summaries exceeds this limit, SSTables with low read rates will shrink their index summaries in order to meet this limit.  However, this is a best-effort process. In extreme conditions Cassandra may need to use more than this amount of memory.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'index_summary_capacity_in_mb' sets a fixed memory pool size in MB for SSTable index summaries. The code initializes the IndexSummaryManager by setting the memory pool size and resize interval based on the values retrieved from DatabaseDescriptor.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered during the initialization of the IndexSummaryManager, which happens when the system starts up or when the IndexSummaryManager is created.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'index_summary_capacity_in_mb' configuration option is that it determines the maximum memory that can be used by SSTable index summaries. If the memory usage exceeds this limit, SSTables with low read rates will shrink their index summaries to meet the limit. However, in extreme conditions, Cassandra may need to use more memory than specified in this configuration.
